content: I’m a pre-final year M.S. student in the College of Computer Science and Technology at Zhejiang University, advised by Prof. Guofeng Zhang. My research interests lie in computer vision and deep learning, particularly in scene understanding, such as intrinsic image decomposition, depth/normal estimation, and 3D plane reconstruction.

My research interests lie in computer vision and deep learning, particularly in scene understanding, such as intrinsic image decomposition, depth/normal estimation, and 3D plane reconstruction.
title: Jundan Luo

authors: Jundan Luo, Zhaoyang Huang, Yijin Li, Xiaowei Zhou, Guofeng Zhang, Hujun Bao
content: Our goal was to alleviate two main difficulties in shading estimation:  Distinguishing shading from reflectance Lack of training data
summary: The project incorporated surface normal cues to decompose an indoor single image into a shading image and a reflectance image.
title: Intrinsic image decomposition with surface normal cues [submitted]

content: There are two main difficulties:  Noisy and semi-dense 3D point clouds. Real-time speed requirement.
summary: The project provided multiple robust plane models with boundaries for the AR SDK user.
title: Real-time Multi-Plane 3D Reconstruction in Indoor Scenes on Mobile Platform

summary: The AR shooting game took place in multiple planar regions in the real world. Move your phone to watch the rabbits and shoot!
title: Jumping Rabbits! -- an AR shooting game taking place on real-world planes
